i'm crowley kin and there's nothing neither of us can do about this // Riz, she/her. here's like,,fandoms nd random stuff. Good Omens, House MD, Ripper Street, LOTR, Marvel, P&P, aesthetic pretty stuff. shitposts. drawings sometimes. idek. it's basically a diary of my hyperfixations.

tags: yes I know he could be an abusive asshole but he was fun some of the time
summary: One of my favourite memories of my dad is when I first showed him this clip of Michael Sheen on a Welsh chat show pretending to...
caption: One of my favourite memories of my dad is when I first showed him this clip of Michael Sheen on a Welsh chat show pretending to be Blofeld. Sheen read it as regular Blofeld and then gave it a “Port Talbot slant.” I cracked up so hard and had to show Dad. He laughed so heartily. For many years after that we’d just say in unison “Oi! Bondi! Where the ‘ell ‘ave you been?!” Mom hated it and still cannot stand this clip. But I don’t care. Thinking of Papa this Father’s Day weekend and every day.

reblog.comment: One of my favourite memories of my dad is when I first showed him this clip of Michael Sheen on a Welsh chat show pretending to be Blofeld. Sheen read it as regular Blofeld and then gave it a “Port Talbot slant.” I cracked up so hard and had to show Dad. He laughed so heartily. For many years after that we’d just say in unison “Oi! Bondi! Where the ‘ell ‘ave you been?!” Mom hated it and still cannot stand this clip. But I don’t care. Thinking of Papa this Father’s Day weekend and every day.

Bondi! Where the ‘ell ‘ave you been?!” Mom hated it and still cannot stand this clip. But I don’t care. Thinking of Papa this Father’s Day weekend and every day.

Bondi! Where the ‘ell ‘ave you been?!” Mom hated it and still cannot stand this clip. But I don’t care. Thinking of Papa this Father’s Day weekend and every day.

summary: Bright Young Michaels and Quentins
title: Bright Young Michaels and Quentins
body:
Watched Bright Young Things last night and was struck by how much Michael Sheen looked like a young Quentin Crisp. Perhaps Stephen Fry intended it…

Also, we were exclaiming every five minutes because there were people dressed as angels and they kept mentioning things like the Ritz and Berkley Square and then Mark Gatiss appeared, randomly…not to mention David Tennant being in it, but we knew about that.

reblog.comment:

Also, we were exclaiming every five minutes because there were people dressed as angels and they kept mentioning things like the Ritz and Berkley Square and then Mark Gatiss appeared, randomly…not to mention David Tennant being in it, but we knew about that.

summary: Anyway, Aziraphale sadly uttering the words "I'm soft" singlehandedly solved my body image issues and my eating problems. Cause...
body: Anyway, Aziraphale sadly uttering the words “I’m soft” singlehandedly solved my body image issues and my eating problems. Cause if my angel is soft I can be too. So I’m just gonna @ @neil-gaiman and say thanks for writing that line (and literally the entire book/series it means more to me than anything)

reblog.comment: Anyway, Aziraphale sadly uttering the words “I’m soft” singlehandedly solved my body image issues and my eating problems. Cause if my angel is soft I can be too. summary: Honestly my favorite thing about the body swap sequence is that it’s so obvious who is who once you think about how they respond...
body:
Honestly my favorite thing about the body swap sequence is that it’s so obvious who is who once you think about how they respond to being Scary.

Like, Crowley knows how to be scary. He’s been scary for 6000 years. He’s got fucking snake eyes. So when he steps into the hellfire and nothing happens and all the angels go Oh Fuck collectively, he can just sit back and let the terror sink in.

Aziraphale, on the other hand, is a squishy little goober who has never been scary once in his life. He’s probably the least intimidating being in the universe. So of course he turns it into this whole ridiculous performance with one liners, and humiliation, and so much manspreading. But if you listen carefully, you can hear that he’s essentially going, “Ah, they are Scared. I am so Scary, Crowley’s going to be so proud of me. What do I do now? What do Scary People do? Oh yes, they say very Nonchalant things about how very Scary they are and how Scared everyone should be of them. Perfect. Now to just ask Michael for a towel…..And…..scene.”
